name: Robo Soccer
brief: Build autonomous robots to compete in an intense soccer match. Score goals and defend your territory.
description: Robo Soccer is the ultimate test of autonomous robotics and strategic programming. Teams will design and build robots capable of playing soccer autonomously, competing in fast-paced matches where precision, speed, and strategy determine the victor.
rules: Maximum robot dimensions: 20cm x 20cm x 20cm
Autonomous operation only - no remote control
Match duration: 10 minutes per round
Standard size football will be used
Pushing opponent robots is allowed, damaging is not

name: Line Follower
brief: Design a robot that navigates complex tracks autonomously. Speed and precision are key to victory.
description: Line Follower challenges teams to create the fastest and most accurate autonomous robot. Navigate through intricate tracks with sharp turns, intersections, and obstacles while maintaining speed and precision.
rules: Robot must follow black line on white surface
Maximum dimensions: 25cm x 25cm x 25cm
Autonomous operation required
No external guidance or communication
Fastest completion time wins

name: Robo War
brief: Ultimate battle of machines. Build powerful combat robots and fight for supremacy in the arena.
description: Robo War is the most intense robotics competition at Gantavya. Build battle-ready robots equipped with weapons and armor to compete in gladiatorial combat. Only the strongest survive.
rules: Maximum weight: 60kg for combat robots
Robot dimensions: up to 1m x 1m x 1m
Wireless remote control allowed within 2.4GHz band
All weapons must have manual shut-off switch
No liquid projectiles or fire-based weapons
Arena is 16ft x 16ft with enclosed boundaries
Match duration: 3 minutes per round
Weapons must not be detachable during match
Robot must have visible kill switch
Intentional damage to arena prohibited
Spinning weapons must have speed controllers
Maximum voltage: 48V DC for all systems
Pneumatic pressure limited to 150 PSI
Sharp weapons must have protective covers during inspection
Team size: minimum 4, maximum 6 members
All team members must wear safety gear in pit area
Robots must pass safety inspection before matches
No entanglement devices or nets allowed
Robots cannot jam opponent's radio signals
Flipping mechanisms must be controlled
Battery must be securely mounted
All wiring must be properly insulated
CO2 cartridges allowed for pneumatics
Robots must be powered off when not in arena
Referee decisions are final and binding
No external power sources during match
Robots must be self-contained units
Wireless cameras allowed for FPV
Immobilized robot loses after 30 seconds
Three knockdowns result in automatic loss
Victory conditions: knockout, judge decision, or tap-out
Judges score on aggression, damage, and control
Teams must provide spare parts for repairs
Pit area must be kept clean and organized
No testing weapons outside designated area
Insurance required for high-damage weapons
Bracket seeding based on robot specifications
Winners advance to championship bracket
Prize distribution: Winner 60%, Runner-up 30%, Semi-finalists 5% each
Special awards for best design and innovation

name: Maze Solver
brief: Navigate through intricate mazes using sensors and algorithms. Find the shortest path to win.
description: Test your robot's intelligence and sensor capabilities in the Maze Solver challenge. Autonomous robots must navigate complex mazes, make decisions at intersections, and find the optimal path to the goal.
rules: Fully autonomous navigation required
Maximum robot size: 20cm x 20cm
Time starts when robot enters maze
Shortest time to goal wins
Robots must handle dead ends and loops

name: Drone Race
brief: High-speed aerial competition through obstacle courses. Master control and precision in three dimensions.
description: Drone Race brings the excitement of aerial robotics to Gantavya. Pilot FPV drones through challenging 3D courses with gates, obstacles, and tight turns. Speed and precision in three dimensions determine the winner.
rules: FPV (First Person View) racing format
Maximum drone weight: 800g
Custom built drones only
Racing through designated gate sequence
Penalties for missing gates or collisions

name: Robotic Arm Challenge
brief: Precision manipulation task using robotic arms. Complete complex tasks with accuracy and efficiency.
description: The Robotic Arm Challenge tests precision engineering and control systems. Teams must design robotic arms capable of performing delicate manipulation tasks, from sorting objects to assembly operations.
rules: Maximum arm reach: 75cm
Wireless or wired control allowed
Complete designated tasks within time limit
Accuracy and speed both scored
Safety protocols must be followed
